newsitem.title: USA: U.S. stocks retreat to negative territory.
newsitem.headline: U.S. stocks retreat to negative territory.

text.p: The Dow industrials dipped to negative ground in afternoon trade on Thursday, seeing some profit-taking as the technology sector drifted and the bond market awaited the outcome of a Treasury auction.
"It's profit-taking and the market is a little bit nervous about the auction," Jim Benning, a BT Brokerage trader said. The Treasury was auctioning $10 billion of 30-year bonds.
The Dow Jones Industrial average slipped 11 points to 8247 while the Nasdaq composite, which has recently driven stocks higher, was down fractionally at 1630.
The long bond was off 1/32 to yield 6.48 percent.
